ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It gives a thorough background to the laboratory methods, mathematical principles, and structure-solving methods behind X-ray crystallography.
I would recommend this course to anyone interested in crystallography. It is a great complement to the lecture course.

Definitely recommend this course, if you ever think that you will be doing any crystallography or structure solving, this is an amazing course that introduces you to alot of important programs in the field.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Although there is a lot more to learn about using X-ray crystallography in a practical sense and we did not go too deeply into the math and physics behind the technique, it was a very solid introduction and I think it will be massively helpful if I end up using the technique during my PhD work.
This course deepened my knowledge of crystallographic structure solution.
Highly prepared me to be comfortable with structure solving for my future thesis work.
